versos: (ruled) Deuteronomy 15:6 - For the Lord your God will bless you as he has promised
(willing) Psalm 110:3 - Your people will offer themselves willingly on the day of your power.;;;

(beware) 2 Peter 3:17 - "Therefore, dear friends, since you have been forewarned, be on your guard so that you may not be carried away by the error of the lawless and fall from your secure position.";;;
(send) Isaiah 6:8 - Then I heard the voice of the Lord saying, "Whom shall I send And who will go for us" And I said, "Here am I. send me";;;
(oath) Matthew 5:33 - "Again, you have heard that it was said to the people long ago, 'Do not break your oath, but fulfill to the Lord the vows you have made.'";;;
(speed) Romans 12:11 - "Do not be slothful in zeal, be fervent in spirit, serve the Lord.";;;
(removeth) Proverbs 10:12 - Hatred stirreth up strifes: but love covereth all sins.;;;
(pitcher) 1 Samuel 26:11 - The Lord forbid that I should stretch out my hand against the Lords anointed. Now get the spear and the water jug that are near his head
(virgin) Isaiah 7:14 - "Therefore the Lord himself will give you a sign: The virgin will conceive and give birth to a son, and will call him Immanuel.";;;
(drinking) Proverbs 20:1 - "Wine is a mocker, strong drink is raging: and whosoever is deceived thereby is not wise.";;;
(emptied) Philippians 2:7 - "but emptied himself, taking the form of a slave, being born in human likeness.";;;
(journey) Genesis 24:50 - "Laban and Bethuel answered, 'This is from the Lord; we can say nothing to you one way or the other.'";;;

(half) Matthew 5:25 - "Settle matters quickly with your adversary who is taking you to court. Do it while you are still together on the way, or your adversary may hand you over to the judge, and the judge may hand you over to the officer, and you may be thrown into prison.";;;
(room) Luke 22:12 - "He will show you a large room upstairs, all furnished. Make preparations there.";;;
(lodge) Isaiah 10:29 - They have gone through the pass, saying, "Geba will be our lodging place for the night." Ramah trembles; Gibeah of Saul flees.;;;

(moreover) 2 Chronicles 6:10 - "The Lord has kept the promise he made. I have succeeded David my father and now I sit on the throne of Israel, just as the Lord promised, and I have built the temple for the Name of the Lord, the God of Israel.";;;
(straw) 1 Corinthians 3:12 - "If anyone builds on this foundation using gold, silver, costly stones, wood, hay or straw,";;;
